quiz.ques: When the switch statement matches the expression with the given labels, how is the comparison done?
quiz.a: Both the datatype and the result of the expression are compared
quiz.b: only the datatype of the expression is compared
quiz.c: only the value of the expression is compared
quiz.details: Switch performs an ‘===’ based comparison, i.e both the value of the expression and its datatype is compared.

quiz.ques: What keyword is used to check whether a given property is valid or not?
quiz.details: The in keyword is used to check whether the given property is valid or not in Javascript.

quiz.ques: When an operator’s value is NULL, the typeof returned by the unary operator is:
quiz.details: Any NULL value of operator will always return typeof object.

quiz.ques: What does the Javascript “debugger” statement do?
quiz.a: It will debug all the errors in the program at runtime
quiz.b: It acts as a breakpoint in a program
quiz.c: It will debug error in the current statement if any
quiz.details: ‘debugger’ statement is used to setup the breakup points at probable points of error in the code snippet, using the debugger window.

quiz.ques: What is the output of the following code snippet?  ===> print(NaN === NaN)
quiz.details: In Javascript, NaN is not considered to be equal to NaN even after using the strict equality operator.

quiz.ques: What will be the output of the following code snippet? ===> print(typeof(NaN));
quiz.details: NaN in Javascript is defined to be of type number despite its name(not a number).

quiz.ques: What does the ‘toLocateString()’ method do in JS?
quiz.c: Returns a localized string representation of an object
quiz.details: The ‘toLocateString()’ method in JS returns a localized string representation of an object.

quiz.ques: The process in which an object or data structure is translated into a format suitable for transferral over a network, or storage is called?
quiz.details: Object Serialization is the process in which an object or data structure is translated into a format suitable for transferral over a network, or storage.

quiz.ques: Which function is used to serialize an object into a JSON string in Javascript?
quiz.details: The JSON.stringify() function is used to convert a JSON object into string format.

quiz.ques: Which of the following are closures in Javascript?
quiz.details: Every time a function is created in JS, a closure is created. So, all closures are functions and functions have a scope chain that is associated with them.

quiz.ques: Which of the following is not a Javascript framework?
quiz.details: Other than Cassandra, all the other options are Javascript frameworks.

quiz.ques: How to stop an interval timer in Javascript?
quiz.details: clearInterval is used to stop an interval timer in JS.

quiz.ques: How are objects compared when they are checked with the strict equality operator?
quiz.a: The contents of the objects are compared
quiz.details: In Javascript, objects are passed by reference and hence the strict equality operator compares their references.

quiz.ques: Which object in Javascript doesn’t have a prototype?
quiz.c: None of the objects have a prototype
quiz.details: Base objects are the only objects in Javascript that don’t have a prototype.

quiz.ques: Which of the following are not server-side Javascript objects?
quiz.details: All of the above options are not server-side Javascript objects.

quiz.ques: html comment should be enclosed between
quiz.details: A

quiz.ques: The following html tag is used to display the content as a moving text
quiz.details: A

quiz.ques: What is the correct syntax of doctype in HTML5?
quiz.details: The correct syntax of HTML5 doctype is <!doctype html>, doctype is the very first thing to write in HTML5. <!doctype html> or <!DOCTYPE HTML> both are same because ‘doctype’ keyword is not case sensitive.

quiz.ques: Which of the following is used to read an HTML page and render it?
quiz.details: A web browser (commonly referred to as a browser) is a software application for retrieving, presenting and traversing information resources on the World Wide Web. A web server process, store and display output to the client as per their request. Web matrix is a discontinued cloud-connected website builder and HTML editor for Windows.

quiz.ques: Which of the following is not a difference between HTML and XHTML?
quiz.a: Charset in both html and xhtml is “text/html”
quiz.b: Tags and attributes are case-insensitive in HTML but not in XHTML
quiz.c: Special characters must be escaped using character entities in XHTML unlike HTML
quiz.d: Charset in html is “text/html” where as in xhtml it is “application/xml+xhtml”
quiz.details: HTML is case insensitive while XHTML is case sensitive. In XHTML, special characters can be escaped using character entites but not in HTML. Charset in HTML is “text/html” where as it is “application/xml+xhtml” for XHTML.

quiz.ques: What is DOM in HTML?
quiz.d: Convention for representing and interacting with objects in html documents
quiz.details: The Document Object Model is a cross-platform and language-independent application programming interface that treats an HTML, XHTML, or XML document as a tree structure. A document can be viewed as a logical tree with help of DOM Model.

quiz.ques: In which part of the HTML metadata is contained?
quiz.details: Metadata is information about data. The meta tag provides metadata/meta information about the HTML document. Metadata will not be displayed on the page. Metadata is present in head. The body tag defines document’s body. A title tag is an HTML element which specifies the title of a web page.

quiz.ques: Which element is used to get highlighted text in HTML5?
quiz.details:
The element is used to highlight a section of text. It is useful for quoting a text or if one wants to bring attention to the text. The tag is used to make text/paragraph bold. tag is used to underline the text you wanted.

This is the example. I like this dog.

quiz.ques: Which of the following is not a HTML5 tag?
quiz.details: <video> tag is used to display video clips in HTML5. Multiple media resources for media elements is specified by <source> tag. Text track for media elements i.e. <audio> & <video> is provided by <track> tag in HTML5. There is no such thing as slider tag in HTML5.

quiz.ques: HTML is a subset of ___________
quiz.details: HTML is a subset of SGML. SGML (Standard Generalized Markup Language) is a standard for specifying a document markup language or tag set.

quiz.ques: Which HTML element is used for short quote?
quiz.details: <em> element indicates emphasis, browser will show the contents of <em> element in italic. A section which is quoted from another source is specified by <blockquote>. The <abbr> defines abbreviation. We used <q> element for shorter quote. Browser put quote around <q> element.

quiz.ques: What is CSS?
quiz.a: CSS is a style sheet language
quiz.b: CSS is designed to separate the presentation and content, including layout, colors, and fonts
quiz.c: CSS is the language used to style the HTML documents
quiz.details: CSS is a style sheet language that stands for Cascading Style Sheet and is used to style HTML documents. CSS is mainly designed to separate the presentation and content, including layout, colors, and fonts.

quiz.ques: Which of the following CSS selectors are used to specify a group of elements?
quiz.details: Class selectors are used to specify a group of elements. Id selector specifies a particular unique element

quiz.ques: What will be the output of following CSS code snippet?===> h1 {color: red text-decoration: underline; font-style: italic;}
quiz.c: color: red, text-decoration: underline and font-style: italic all works
quiz.d: text-decoration: underline and font-style: italic works
quiz.details: In this case, we should see the browser continue to parse the value of color as “red text-decoration: underline” before it sees a closing semicolon. The font-style property that follows would then be used. Because the color property has an illegal value, it should be ignored.

quiz.ques: Which of the following is the correct syntax to link an external style sheet in the HTML file?
quiz.details: HTML file must contain a reference to the external style sheet file. External style sheet files are defined within the <link> element and it should be inside the <head> section. href attribute specifies the URL of the linked resource.

quiz.ques: Which of the following function defines a linear gradient as a CSS image?
quiz.details: linear-gradient() function defines a linear gradient as a CSS image. Creating a linear gradient function we should define minimum of two color stops. color stops will tell the browser which colors to use in the gradients for smooth transitions.

quiz.ques: Which of the following CSS property can be used to set the image as a border instead of the border style?
quiz.details: The border-image-source property specifies the path to the image to be used as a border (instead of the normal border around an element).

quiz.ques: Which of the following CSS property sets what kind of line decorations are added to an element, such as underlines, overlines, etc?
quiz.details: The text-decoration-line property defines the type of line decorations that are added to an element, such as underlines, overlines, etc.

quiz.ques: Which of the following property allows a marquee to be used in the case of a text-overflow?
quiz.details: Explanation: overflow-style is a CSS property that allows a marquee to be used in the case of a text-overflow.

quiz.ques: Which of the following CSS3 property can be used to allow line breaks within words?
quiz.details: Explanation: word-break property can be used to allow line breaks within the words. Syntax:word-break: break-all | keep-all | normal

quiz.ques: Which of the following are the advantages of React.js?
quiz.a: React.js can increase the application's performance with Virtual DOM.
quiz.b: React.js is easy to integrate with other frameworks such as Angular, BackboneJS since it is only a view library.
quiz.c: React.js can render both on client and server side.
quiz.details: D is the correct option as all of the above statements are the advantages of React.js.

quiz.ques: Which of the following acts as the input of a class-based component?
quiz.details: D props is the correct answer.

quiz.ques: What is a state in React?
quiz.details: B is the correct answer.

quiz.ques: What are the two ways to handle data in React?
quiz.details: State & Props is the correct answer.

quiz.ques: Which of the following is a must API for every React.js component?
quiz.details: B is the correct option. The renderComponent is a must API for every React.js component.

quiz.ques: Does React.js create a VIRTUAL DOM in the memory?
quiz.details: A is the correct option as React.js creates a VIRTUAL DOM in the memory.
